instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00939: What is 820-00939? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: Mac Mini 2018 model A1993 MLB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00939</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - does not boot, shuts down
threads.message:
Hello. The Mac Mini 2018 starts up but shuts down just before showing the OS logo and progress bar, then restarts in the same way in an infinite loop. When I do not touch the keyboard, Mac Mini starts up (white LED lits up) and shuts down after 4-5 seconds with no picture on HDMI screen (but screen is initialised as it goes to energy saving when Mac shuts down). Then it starts up again in the same way in an infinite loop. When I hold eg. Alt key, the logo appears followed by the boot screen, and I can select the startup disk but neither the internal nor external disks can be started up from as of an immediate shutdown. What I did with no luck (still shuts down and restarts):

1. Replaced RTC battery (old was 2.8V but replaced just in case)
2. Replaced RAM memory (100% tested)
3. Started Mac up with a single module in each slot
4. Tried to boot to Recovery mode
5. Tried to boot to ASD
6. Tried to boot to Safe Mode
7. Revived T2 chip in DFU mode
8. Resoldered CPU (full reflow with all balls melted)

All the voltages are present, it is just a sudden shutdown right before the loading logo and progress bar appeared. Where should I focus my attention to?

threads.title: Mac Mini 2018 model A1993 MLB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00939</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - does not boot, shuts down
Mac Mini 2018 model A1993 MLB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00939</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - does not boot, shuts down
threads.message: Unfortunately, I cannot restore BridgeOS as of the very high importance of data. I will now try Target Mode and OS backup onto the external drive.

threads.title: Mac Mini 2018 model A1993 MLB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00939</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - does not boot, shuts down
threads.message: I can confirm that Target Mode did the trick regarding data retrieval, so I can now fully restore the BridgeOS to see if it helps to rectify the main problem.
